title: 109_s2614
content: The Act may be cited as the "Alternative Energy Refueling System Act of 2006". It pertains to alternative energy refueling systems. The Solid Waste Disposal Act is amended to include definitions for alternative energy refueling systems, which are used to refuel vehicles with compressed natural gas. The Solid Waste Disposal Act is amended to include definitions for alternative energy refueling systems, such as compressed natural gas, E-85 ethanol, specified fuels under the Internal Revenue Code, and other alternative fuels as determined by the Administrator. Eligible entities include refueling vendors or owners/operators of service stations or facilities for refueling vehicles. The Administrator will establish a reimbursement program for eligible entities to cover a portion of the costs of purchasing and installing alternative energy refueling systems. The Administrator will establish a reimbursement program for eligible entities to cover costs of purchasing and installing alternative energy refueling systems, replacing petroleum tanks or systems. Eligible entities must submit an application with required information for reimbursement within the specified timeline. The Administrator verifies the installation and operation of alternative energy refueling systems for reimbursement to eligible entities. An eligible entity receiving a tax credit for alternative fuel vehicle refueling property cannot get reimbursement for an alternative energy refueling system on the same property. The tax credit for alternative energy refueling systems is limited to 2 systems per facility owned or operated by the eligible entity. The reimbursement for an alternative energy refueling system is capped at 30% of the system's cost or $30,000, whichever is less. This limit does not impact other trust fund projects. The Administrator cannot use Trust Fund money obligated for other projects. This paragraph does not affect an owner or operator's obligations to comply with other provisions. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to comply with the Superfund Amendments and Reauthorization Act of 1986 and the Alternative Energy Refueling System Act of 2006.
